body.p: There was a meeting of the Jack- son County Safety committee held j Monday afternoon in the office of the county highway commissioner. Those present were Mrs. A. P. Jones, Miss I Grace Webb, O. H. Overlien, Bert F. j Johnson and Merlin Horswill. A. R. I Gunnison, state traffic officer from Eau Claire, was present and spoke on his varied experiences as traffic of- ficer in 11 counties and made sugges- tions and recommendations. Several matters were taken up before the meeting. Miss Webb read replies to inquiries sent village schools as to what they thought regarding safety j measures. Traffic Officer Bemie Finch was I cruising along north of Merrillan > early Sunday morning a short dis- ; tance behind a Hennepin Transfer ! trick driven by Morris Thompson. He l turned out to pass a car, the truck j struck the soft shoulder of the road j and overturned, pinning the driver | between the steering wheel and a heavy box of freight. It was neces- j sary to get a bar to pry him loose j from his precarious position. For- tunately he was not injured much. | and suffered no broken bones. He : was carrying a load of heavy freight j from Chicago to Minneapolis. Jack Xeindorp, who has been in the Hancock Hardware store since its or- ganization here, left Sunday for Mil- waukee to take up his new duties ; with the Pittsburg Plate Glass Com- i pany. His family is remaining here for the present. Mrs. Anna Segan of Kansas City, j was here on business yesterday.
